intro: Aconitum napellus f. amoenum, commonly known as the dwarf monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple hooded flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring palmate leaves with deeply lobed edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its toxic nature, it should be handled with care.
